description.en:
The course deals with a number of relevant economic geography topics:
-what is economic geography
-the location problem analysed
-location theories: classical, neo-classical and alternative approaches
-location factors
-demography of the enterprise
-city and economics
-urban economic development: competition and networks
-internal urban differentiation: land use
-production networks in a global economy
-'new economic geography'
-geography of the world economy
-evolutionary economic geography
description.et:
Kursus käitleb olulisi majandusgeograafia teemasid:
- mis on majandusgeograafia?
- asukoha teooriate analüüs
-asukoha teooriad: klassikaline, neo-klassikaline ja alternatiivsed lähenemised
- asukoha faktorid
-ettevõtte demograafia
-linn ja majandus
-linna majandusareng: konkurents ja võrgustikud
-sisemine linna jagunemine: maakasutus
-tootmisvõrgustikud maailmamajanduses
- "uus majandusgeograafia"
- geograafia maailmamajanduses
- evolutsiooniline majandusgeograafia

objectives.en: The course provides students with an understanding of contemporary urban networks, including their role in economic processes, creativity and the logistical challenges of contemporary cities and urban systems.
objectives.et: Kursus annab ülevaate tänapäevase linnasüsteemide võrgustike üle, nende rollist majandusprotsessides, loovusest ja logistilistest väljakutsetest tänapäeva linnades ja linnasüsteemides.

learning_outcomes.en: After attending the course, the student will be:
* familiar with the basic concepts of economic geography and urban networks
learning_outcomes.et: * teab majandusgeograafia põhilisi kontseptsioone ja linnavõrgustikke

learning_outcomes.en: * able to understand how businesses deal with decisions concerning locational choice;
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab aru saada, kuidas ettevõttedon seotud asukoha valikuga

learning_outcomes.en: * able to answer questions regarding urban geography
* able to analyze the complex relationship between city and economy
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab analüüsida linna- ja majandussuhete keerukust

learning_outcomes.en: * able to understand how creative industries operate and what their contribution is to the urban economy
learning_outcomes.et: * oskab arusaada kuidas loomemajandused opereerivad ning mis on nede panus linnamajandusse.

independent_work.et:
1. Form a group of students (groups can be formed by the program coordinator or you can form your own group. Number of students in the group will be given before the course starts. Make sure there is a mixture of nationalities in your group) and choose: (a) an industry or a producer services) and (b) a city in which this industry/producer service is located. For instance, Volvo Cars in the city of Ghent; A. Le Coq in the city of Tartu; Stora Enso Oyj in the city of Helsinki.
2. Write a DRAFT report of maximum 5 to 7 pages (e.g. executive summary):
-1 page: explain the industry/producer service Y, situate city X (brevity is essential)
-3 pages: why this industry/producer service Y is located in city X. So divide your group in 3, where each student
looks at each possible approach (neo/classical vs. evolutionary economic vs. institutional)
-1 page: conclusions
3. Submit your draft report in Moodle for the given dealine.
4. You will be asked to present your report on seminar and a discussion will follow. Presentation is
maximum 15 minutes. This means use no more than 15 Powerpoint slides (1 slide = 1 minute) for presentation,
and then a short discussion will follow.
5. Having had the lectures, presented the report and receiving feedback, and based on the discussion: write a
FINAL report (max. 10 pages). This report will form the basis for the grading.

description.et: The report will form the basis for the grading.
